properties.tree_description:
NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Repeated topping history; crown appears largely non-vigorous with only a single remaining leader and epicormic shoots. Condition consistent with severe, repeated canopy reduction and associated decline.
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:Water Oak Tree Size (DBH):33Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Girdled by embedded wire and hog wire at the trunk. Upper leader structure indicates historic topping event.
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Water Oak Tree Size (DBH):38Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Codominant stems with extended bark inclusion (approx. 10 ft visible seam). Likely basal sprout origin. Girdled by cable and hog wire.
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:Water Oak Tree Size (DBH):19Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Embedded chain-link fencing. Interdependent structural root plate relationship with Tree 4. Off-balance canopy due to phototropism with lean toward neighboring dwelling.
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:Pecan Tree Size (DBH):16Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Engulfed in English ivy. Exposed sapwood with visible decay. Lower stem inspection partially limited by invasive coverage.
		
		
			Tree number:7Species:Pecan Tree Size (DBH):21Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Covered in invasive growth. Girdled by chain-link fencing. One leader previously topped. Structural alteration evident.
		
		
			Tree number:8Species:Central leader failure with ram’s horn wound wood and visible decay extending into main stem. Tear-out consistent with species failure pattern.
		
		
			Tree number:9Species:Winged Elm Tree Size (DBH):25Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:NoneReason for Removal:OtherComments:Two leaders with one resting on another. Multiple historic topping events with epicormic growth.
		
		
			Tree number:10Species:Pecan Tree Size (DBH):32Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:None Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Overall canopy dieback/ decline. Central leader failure with visible decay and wood loss. Bole area inspection limited due to English ivy coverage

properties.address: 599 FLAT SHOALS AVE SE, ATLANTA GA 30316
properties.tree_description: The White Oak (Quercus alba) measuring approximately 30 inches DBH is causing significant structural damage due to its aggressive root system. The roots have extended beneath and through the retaining wall, resulting in displacement, cracking, and structural failure of the wall. The retaining wall has been compromised and is no longer able to properly support or contain the surrounding soil.
